qoi_block_size.description:
block size over which the quantity of interest errors are averaged,
1 for pointwise

qoi_pwe.description:
positive (pointwise) absolute error bound over the quantity of
interest

sperr_chunks.description: 3D size of the chunks (z, y, x) that SPERR uses internally

data_pwe.description: optional positive pointwise absolute error bound over the data

qoi_k.description: positive quantity of interest k parameter (3.0 is a good default)

high_prec.description: high precision mode for SPERR, useful for small error bounds

description:
Codec providing compression using QPET-SPERR.

Arrays that are higher-dimensional than 3D are encoded by compressing each
3D slice with QPET-SPERR independently. Specifically, the array's shape is
interpreted as `[.., depth, height, width]`. If you want to compress 3D
slices along three different axes, you can swizzle the array axes
beforehand.

_version.description: The codec's encoding format version. Do not provide this parameter explicitly.

title: QpetSperrCodec
